Directions: Read the following poem based on a Greek myth then answer each question that follows.
Title: Phaethon
Author: by Morris Bishop
Content: His car was bright with chrysolite,
Who begged to have a try.
On high beware the Crab, the Bear,
Against the Archer and the Bull
But Phaethon could lay it on;
Out of the purple doors of dawn
They felt his hand could not command.
And so, my boy, no, no, my boy
Copyright: “Phaethon” from Man the Myth-Maker, 2nd edition. Ed. by W.T. Jewkes. Copyright (c) 1981; 85 by Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. Published by Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. All rights reserved. Used with permission.
